body.p: Before moving the Reactor, plan for the following clearances:

li.p: Minimum service clearance, front: 36" [914 mm], which includes front ventilation clearance

Ventilation openings of the Reactor shall require not less than 6" [152 mm] clearance from wall or other passive partitions and not less than 12" [305 mm] clearance from ventilation openings of adjacent Reactor or of other electrical equipment.

body.p:
Move the Reactor off its pallet with a forklift or other lifting device as follows:
The current-limiting Reactor is bolted to a pallet. With the pallet resting on the floor, remove the bolts.
Insert forklift blade under the Reactor cabinet at the rear of unit because the rear of unit is heavier than the front. There is 6" [152 mm] clearance from bottom of the enclosure to the floor.
Side panels must be removed for electrical connection to adjacent equipment. If adjacent equipment is already installed before the Reactor is placed, then remove the side panels just before placing the Reactor. Panels lift off. Discard the removed side panels.
Move the unit to its installation location and withdraw the forklift blades. Units have no casters and should be precisely positioned with the forklift. Moving and Anchoring the Reactor
